title: ADMINISTERED DRUG PRODUCT
description:
The ADMINISTERED DRUG PRODUCT is the qualitative and quantitative composition of a medicinal product in the dose form approved for administration.
[ISO 11616:2017 IDMP Pharmaceutical Product, 3.1.24 pharmaceutical product]
It is the DRUG PRODUCT after transformation, if applicable, for administration to or use by the patient. In many instances, the ADMINISTERED DRUG PRODUCT is equal to the DRUG PRODUCT. However, there are instances where the DRUG PRODUCT must undergo a transformation before being administered to the patient as the ADMINISTERED DRUG PRODUCT and the two are not equal.

id.title: productId
id.description: Unique identifier of the object ADMINISTERED DRUG PRODUCT.

administeredDoseFormCode.description:

Please use sapCode instead.

descriptions.description: The TEXT is any human readible text. It may be unstructured data ("free text") or it may be generated from structured data ("auto text"). It may have different maximum length. It may occur in different LANGUAGEs and WRITING SYSTEMs.

routesOfAdministration.title: routesOfAdministration
routesOfAdministration.description:
ROUTE OF ADMINISTRATION indicates the part of the body on which, through which or into which the medicinal product is to be introduced. The METHOD OF ADMINISTRATION is used mostly in the veterinary field to indicate the way the medicinal product is to be administered to the animals.
The routes and methods of administration terms appear in a simple flat list, with no hierarchy and generally no links to other terms, since they can be considered as independent terms.
This list is for Human and Veterinary use. 
Uses:
This list of Standard Terms, which has 'European Guideline' status, must be used in EU marketing authorisation application dossiers for medicines for human and animal use.

targetQuantity.title: targetQuantity
targetQuantity.description:
The Target Quantity of the ADMINISTERED DRUG PRODUCT is calculated from the Target Quantity Drug Product of the TRANSFORMED DRUG PRODUCT FOR CONFIGURATION.
For TRANSFORMATION No transformation the Target Quantity is the Target Quantity of the TRANSFORMED DRUG PRODUCT FOR CONFIGURATION.
For TRANSFORMATION Dilution (liquid + liquid) or Mixing (solid + solid) the Target Quantity is the sum of the Target Quantities of the TRANSFORMED DRUG PRODUCTs FOR CONFIGURATION.
For TRANSFORMATION Dissolution (solid + liquid) or Dispersion (solid + liquid or gaseous + liquid) the Target Quantity is the Target Quantity Drug Product of the liquid TRANSFORMED DRUG PRODUCT FOR CONFIGURATION.

transformedDrugs.title: transformedDrugs
transformedDrugs.description: The TRANSFORMED DRUG PRODUCT FOR CONFIGURATION identifies the DRUG PRODUCT FOR CONFIGURATION that is transformed into a ADMINISTERED DRUG PRODUCT. It is different from the DRUG PRODUCT FOR CONFIGURATION in that it provides a target quantity describing the amount used in the specified ADMINISTERED DRUG PRODUCT. With that, the INGREDIENTS and their quantity of the TRANSFORMED DRUG PRODUCT FOR CONFIGURATION can be derived from the PRODUCT COMPOSITION.

uomSapCode.title: unitOfMeasure.sapCode
uomSapCode.description: The unconverted Code in Column MSEHI of SAP table T006.

uomRefId.title: unitOfMeasure.referenceDataId
uomRefId.description: The Reference Data ID is the (technical) Identifier of all REFERNCE DATA maintained in the Reference Data Management System.

alternateTargetQuantityValue.title: alternateTargetQuantityOfPresentation.alternateTargetQuantity
alternateTargetQuantityValue.description:
The Alternate Target Quantity is the Numerator of the conversion factor that converts a Quantity 1 quantified in a UoM into a Quantity 2 quantified in an Alternate UoM.
The conversion rule is: Quantity 1 [UoM] = Quantity 2 [Alternate UoM].
This conversion rule can be rearranged to calculate a conversion factor: 1 [UoM] = (Quantity 2 / Quantity 1) [Alternate UoM]. Here, Quantity 2 is the Numerator and Quantity 1 is the Denominator of the conversion factor, respecitively.
The Alternate Target Quantity quantified in the Alternate UNIT OF MEASURE is the same amount as the Target Quantity quantified in the UNIT OF MEASURE.
The Alternate Target Quantity defined for an UoP of an ADMINISTERED DRUG PRODUCT shall be one.

alternateTargetQuantityUopSapCode.title: alternateTargetQuantityUop.sapCode
alternateTargetQuantityUopSapCode.description: The SAP Code is the unique identifier from SAP to identify the data record for UNIT OF PRESENTATION.

alternateTargetQuantityUopRefId.title: alternateTargetQuantityUop.referenceDataId
alternateTargetQuantityUopRefId.description: The Reference Data ID is the (technical) Identifier of all REFERNCE DATA maintained in the Reference Data Management System.

prevailingId.title: prevailingId
prevailingId.description:
One ADMINISTERED DRUG PRODUCT must have a Prevailing ID if its GLOBAL LIFECYCLE STATUS is set to 99, duplicate (1). Otherwise the Prevailing ID remains empty (0).
This directs the user to the prevailing ADMINISTERED DRUG PRODUCT.

RouteAndMethodOfAdministration.description:
ROUTE OF ADMINISTRATION indicates the part of the body on which, through which or into which the medicinal product is to be introduced. The METHOD OF ADMINISTRATION is used mostly in the veterinary field to indicate the way the medicinal product is to be administered to the animals.
The routes and methods of administration terms appear in a simple flat list, with no hierarchy and generally no links to other terms, since they can be considered as independent terms.
This list is for Human and Veterinary use. 
Uses:
This list of Standard Terms, which has 'European Guideline' status, must be used in EU marketing authorisation application dossiers for medicines for human and animal use.

TransformedDrugProductForConfiguration.title: transformedDrugProductForConfiguration
TransformedDrugProductForConfiguration.description: The TRANSFORMED DRUG PRODUCT FOR CONFIGURATION identifies the DRUG PRODUCT FOR CONFIGURATION that is transformed into a ADMINISTERED DRUG PRODUCT. It is different from the DRUG PRODUCT FOR CONFIGURATION in that it provides a target quantity describing the amount used in the specified ADMINISTERED DRUG PRODUCT. With that, the INGREDIENTS and their quantity of the TRANSFORMED DRUG PRODUCT FOR CONFIGURATION can be derived from the PRODUCT COMPOSITION.

drugProductId.title: drugProductForConfiguration.productId
drugProductId.description: Unique identifier of the object DRUG PRODUCT FOR CONFIGURATION.

targetQuantity.title: targetQuantityDrugProduct
targetQuantity.description:
The Target Quantity Drug Product is the Target Quantity of the TRANSFORMED DRUG PRODUCT FOR CONFIGURATION used in the TRANSFORMATION into the ADMINISTERED DRUG PRODUCT.
The Target Quantity Drug Product is used to derive the Quantities of the INGREDIENTs of the ADMINISTERED DRUG PRODUCT from the INGREDIENTs of the corresponding PRODUCT COMPOSITIONs of the used DRUG PRODUCTs FOR CONFIGURATION.
If the target quantity of the ADMINISTERED DRUG PRODUCT is identical to the target quantity of the corresponding PRODUCT COMPOSITION, then the quantities of the INGREDIENTs of the PRODUCT COMPOSITION are the quantities of the INGREDIENTs of the ADMINISTERED DRUG PRODUCT.
If the target quantity of the ADMINISTERED DRUG PRODUCT is a multiple of the target quantity of the corresponding PRODUCT COMPOSITION, then the quantities of the INGREDIENTs of the PRODUCT COMPOSITION must be multiplied to derive the quantities of the INGREDIENTs of the ADMINISTERED DRUG PRODUCT.

transformedIngredients.title: transformedIngredient
transformedIngredients.description: The QUANTITY IN TRANSFORMED DRUG PRODUCT is the quantity of the INGREDIENT listed in a PRODUCT COMPOSITION as used in a ADMINISTERED DRUG PRODUCT.

IngredientQuantityInTransformedDrugProdu.title: ingredientQuantityInTransformedDrugProduct
IngredientQuantityInTransformedDrugProdu.description: The QUANTITY IN TRANSFORMED DRUG PRODUCT is the quantity of the INGREDIENT listed in a PRODUCT COMPOSITION as used in a ADMINISTERED DRUG PRODUCT.

max.title: maximumQuantityInTransformedDrugProduct
max.description: The Maximum Quantity in Transformed Drug Product is calculated for one INGREDIENT of one TRANSFORMED DRUG PRODUCT in one ADMINISTERED DRUG PRODUCT based on its Maximum Quantity in the PRODUCT COMPOSITION, Target Quantity of that PRODUCT COMPOSITION and the Target Quantity of the TRANSFORMED DRUG PRODUCT FOR CONFIGURATION.

min.title: minimumQuantityInTransformedDrugProduct
min.description: The Minimum Quantity in Transformed Drug Product is calculated for one INGREDIENT of one TRANSFORMED DRUG PRODUCT in one ADMINISTERED DRUG PRODUCT based on its Minimum Quantity in the PRODUCT COMPOSITION, Target Quantity of that PRODUCT COMPOSITION and the Target Quantity of the TRANSFORMED DRUG PRODUCT FOR CONFIGURATION.

quantity.title: quantityInTransformedDrugProduct
quantity.description: The Quantity in Transformed Drug Product is calculated for one INGREDIENT of one TRANSFORMED DRUG PRODUCT in one ADMINISTERED DRUG PRODUCT based on its Quantity in the PRODUCT COMPOSITION, Target Quantity of that PRODUCT COMPOSITION and the Target Quantity of the TRANSFORMED DRUG PRODUCT FOR CONFIGURATION.

referenceStrength.title: referenceStrength.quantity
referenceStrength.description:
The Quantity of a REFERENCE SUBSTANCE is the REFERENCE STRENGTH Quantity.
It is calculated from the Quantity of the INGREDIENT, if maintained (0..1), multiplied with the REFERENCE STRENGTH CALCULATION Factor.

referenceStrengthMin.title: referenceStrength.minimumQuantity
referenceStrengthMin.description:
The Minimum Quantity of a REFERENCE SUBSTANCE is the REFERENCE STRENGTH Minimum Quantity.
It is calculated from the Minimum Quantity of the INGREDIENT, if maintained (0..1), multiplied with the REFERENCE STRENGTH CALCULATION Factor.

referenceStrengthMax.title: referenceStrength.maximumQuantity
referenceStrengthMax.description:
The Maximum Quantity of a REFERENCE SUBSTANCE is the REFERENCE STRENGTH Maximum Quantity.
It is calculated from the Maximum Quantity of the INGREDIENT, if maintained (0..1), multiplied with the REFERENCE STRENGTH CALCULATION Factor.
